posts.body:
>>3149aab5-50bc-4c7c-8071-d923b4ae59fc

Run everything from a VM to compartmentalize. Clean/delete VMs regularly. 

Use a VPN and TOR.

A lot rests on if the VPN provider keeps logs. So finding a good provider is good. One that shares IPs is good too because it provides some deniability. 

Pay for VPN in crypto. 

Spoof useragent and use private browsing to mitigate client fingerprinting. 

It all depends who you are defending against. If you are defending against just your local network(say your work/school) then a VPN is fine. It is good to run TOR over a VPN so the ISP cant see you running TOR. It is also good to run your own VPN on your own VPS. 

It is good to change things a lot. To prevent fingerprinting

>>28b06705-4b98-4b31-ac31-da92dfc99ad8
That makes sense. But if you follow this approach you need to make sure you know what everyone else is doing. 

By changing things i mean changing VPN, OS, private keys, nicks. so the profile is smaller.

>>be3f4cd1-dd87-4bae-ae0d-50c5190027ab
Yeah...

FUCK THE DEMs

They are gun grabbing socialists. hard pass.

>>88e630f7-7abc-4cdf-819b-6b20ec622a0f

>>d2db2775-92b1-412c-bc15-4b0047ed7ba6

>>8078aec1-3e52-41fc-b5d1-09de2451ed5e
TOR is the best of course. but people dont like it becaues its slow etc. 

A lot of people use VPN first then TOR so the ISP and local admins cant see them running TOR
also consider running things in a VM because if you are attacked through zeronet or tor to try to deanon you then it  will be harder to do so because its all in a VM.

>>92115ed9-e813-4690-b7e5-ea13d9229262
UPnP lets TOR and torrent not require open ports on router.

If you are on TOR you can receieve connections through TOR.

If a clearnet entity wants to tlak to a tor entity they need a gateway/tor node thats accessible to them.

I dont know what ur complaining about

>>5b78df93-2d18-4da9-8f15-cf120bac28ee

It is NOT for all TOR

>>b48c882d-5f85-4a9d-8db4-636d7415a983

>>fd43db79-84bc-49af-a01c-65fce659b4a7
A new key is the same as a new IP. it is the only thing that identifies you.

>>90f79375-b3ae-4a6e-9da6-ab00a23965db
It deletes their content so you wont be seeding it. If everyone mutes the same person their content will be gone.
